required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Investigate Efficacy and Safety of a Single Injection of Org 36286 for Ovarian Stimulation Using Daily Recombinant FSH as Reference (Ensure)(P05690/MK-8962-001)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Randomized, Double-blind, Active-controlled, Equivalence Clinical Trial to Investigate the Efficacy and Safety of a Single Injection of 100 µg Org 36286 (Corifollitropin Alfa) to Induce Multifollicular Development for Controlled Ovarian Stimulation (COS) Using Daily Recombinant FSH (recFSH) as a Reference

brief_summary.textblock: Clinical trial objectives are to investigate the efficacy and safety of a single injection of 100 μg Org 36286 in women weighing 60 kg or less to induce multifollicular development for controlled ovarian stimulation (COS), using daily recFSH as a reference.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized, double-blind, active-controlled, equivalence clinical trial investigating the efficacy and safety of a new treatment regimen with Org 36286, a recombinant gonadotropin applied to initiate and sustain follicular stimulation in COS for Assisted Reproductive Technology (ART). For this regimen, patients receive a single injection of Org 36286 and one week later, treatment is continued with daily recFSH up to the day of triggering final oocyte maturation. In the reference group patients receive daily injections of recFSH up to the day of triggering final oocyte maturation. Equivalence between the two treatment groups in the number of oocytes retrieved is the primary objective of this trial.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Cumulus-oocyte-complexes Retrieved, Per Attempt
primary_outcome.time_frame: One COS cycle with cumulus-oocyte-complex retrieval (up to a maximum total duration of 21 days)
primary_outcome.description: The primary efficacy parameter was defined as the number of cumulus-oocyte-complexes retrieved from participants in a controlled ovarian stimulation (COS) cycle for in vitro fertilization (IVF) and/or intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI). For participants who did not have cumulus-oocyte-complex retrieval, the number retrieved was set to zero.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One COS cycle (up to a maximum total duration of 19 stimulation days)
secondary_outcome.description: Total dose of recFSH (IU) administered was defined as the total amount of recFSH needed by participants to reach the criterion for administration of hCG (at least 3 follicles >=17mm).

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Dose of recFSH Administered From Day 8 Onwards
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Stimulation Day 8 of COS cycle up to day of hCG administration (up to a maximum total duration of 19 stimulation days)
secondary_outcome.description: Total dose of recFSH (IU) needed from Stimulation Day 8 onwards to reach the criterion for administration of hCG (at least 3 follicles >=17mm).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Days Treated With recFSH
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One COS cycle (up to a maximum total duration of 19 stimulation days)
secondary_outcome.description: Numbers of days treated with recFSH was defined as the total number of days participants received recFSH (excluding coasting days) until they reached the criterion for administration of hCG (at least 3 follicles >=17mm).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One COS cycle (up to a maximum total duration of 19 stimulation days)
secondary_outcome.description: Total duration of stimulation was defined as the number of days from first drug administration up to and including the Day of hCG administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Follicle Stimulating Hormone (FSH) Levels (Restricted to Participants With hCG Injection)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to 2 weeks after ET (up to maximum of 6 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for assessment of serum FSH were taken prior to injection on Stimulation Day 1, Day 3, Day 5, Day 8, Day of hCG, Day of ET, at the visit two weeks after ET.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Lutenizing Hormone (LH) Levels (Restricted to Participants With hCG Injection)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to 2 weeks after ET (up to maximum of 6 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for assessment of serum LH were taken prior to injection on Stimulation Day 1, Day 3, Day 5, Day 8, Day of hCG, Day of ET, at the visit two weeks after ET.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Estradiol (E2) Levels (Restricted to Participants With hCG Injection)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to 2 weeks after ET (up to maximum of 6 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for assessment of serum E2 were taken prior to injection on Stimulation Day 1, Day 3, Day 5, Day 8, Day of hCG, Day of ET, at the visit two weeks after ET.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Progesterone (P) Levels (Restricted to Participants With hCG Injection)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to 2 weeks after ET (up to maximum of 6 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for assessment of serum P were taken prior to injection on Stimulation Day 1, Day 3, Day 5, Day 8, Day of hCG, Day of ET, at the visit two weeks after ET.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Inhibin-B Levels (Restricted to Participants With hCG Injection)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to 2 weeks after ET (up to maximum of 6 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for assessment of serum inhibin-B were taken prior to injection on Stimulation Day 1, Day 3, Day 5, Day 8, Day of hCG, Day of ET, at the visit two weeks after ET.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number and Size Distribution of Follicles During Stimulation and on the Day of hCG Administration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose up to day of hCG administration (up to a maximum total duration of 19 stimulation days, including day of hCG administration)
secondary_outcome.description: For each participant, the number of follicles ≥11 mm, ≥15 mm, and ≥17 mm, documented by ultrasonography on defined days during the treatment cycle, was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number and Quality of Oocytes Assessed Prior to ICSI (Restricted to Participants With ICSI Only)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 hours after administration of hCG
secondary_outcome.description: The number of oocytes used for ICSI was assessed and categorized based on their quality (i.e., metaphase I oocytes, metaphase II oocytes, and germinal vesicles stage oocytes).
Fertilization rate, defined as 100 times the ratio of the number of fertilized 2 pronuclei (PN) oocytes obtained and the number of oocytes incubated, was tabulated for each treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number and Quality of Embryos Obtained at Day 3 (Restricted to Participants With IVF and/or ICSI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post fertilization Day 3 (up to a maximum of 2 days after hCG administration)
secondary_outcome.description: Embryo quality was rated Grade 1, 2, 3, or other. Grade 1 represented excellent quality; Grade 2 good quality; Grade 3 fair quality. "Other" grade embryos were those that did not qualify as Grade 1, 2, or 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Implantation Rate for Participants With ET
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 weeks after ET within a treatment cycle (up to a maximum 10 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: The implantation rate was defined as 100 times the maximum number of gestational sacs as assessed by any ultrasound scan (USS) after ET divided by the number of embryos transferred (per participant), maximized to 100%.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 10 weeks after ET (up to a maximum of 14 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: A miscarriage, also known as a "spontaneous abortion," was defined as the loss of a fetus without induction or instrumentation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 10 weeks after ET (up to a maximum of 14 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: A Biochemical Pregnancy was defined as a pregnancy proven by a biochemical pregnancy test. (Participants not having a positive biochemical pregnancy test result, but with an ultrasound showing at least one gestational sac were counted as having a biochemical pregnancy.) A Clinical Pregnancy was defined as the presence of at least one gestational sac as assessed by an USS scan. A Vital Pregnancy was considered the presence of at least one fetus with heart activity as assessed by USS. An Ongoing Pregnancy was defined as the presence of at least one fetus with heart activity at least 10 weeks after ET as assessed by USS or Doppler, or confirmed by live birth.

arm_group.description: Participants received a single subcutaneous (SC) injection of corifollitropin alfa 100 μg (Org 36286) on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily placebo-recombinant Follicle Stimulating Hormone (recFSH) injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including Day of Human Chorion Gonadotropin (hCG) administration. Participants also received Gonadotropin Releasing Hormone (GnRH) antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP). Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day by intramuscular [IM] injection), starting on day of oocyte pick-up (OPU) and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

Participants in the reference group received a single SC injection of placebo-corifollitropin alfa administered on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily SC recFSH 150 IU injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including the day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP) administration. Participants also received the GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG. Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on the day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

intervention.description: GnRH antagonist (ganirelix) administered SC at a dose of 0.25 mg/day
hCG 5,000 IU or 10,000 IU administered SC
Progesterone was started on the day of oocyte pick-up (OPU) and continued for at least 6 weeks or up to menses. Participants received at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM.
Placebo-recFSH administered at the equivalent volume of 150 IU/day.
Single SC injection of placebo-corifollitropin alfa administered on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle.
Open-label recFSH administered up to a maximum dose of 200 IU/day.

results_reference.citation: Corifollitropin alfa Ensure Study Group. Corifollitropin alfa for ovarian stimulation in IVF: a randomized trial in lower-body-weight women. Reprod Biomed Online. 2010 Jul;21(1):66-76. doi: 10.1016/j.rbmo.2010.03.019. Epub 2010 Mar 28. Erratum in: Reprod Biomed Online. 2014 Sep;29(3):395.

group.title: 100 μg Corifollitropin Alfa
group.description: Participants received a single subcutaneous (SC) injection of corifollitropin alfa 100 μg (Org 36286) on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily placebo-recombinant Follicle Stimulating Hormone (recFSH) injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including Day of Human Chorion Gonadotropin (hCG) administration. Participants also received Gonadotropin Releasing Hormone (GnRH) antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP). Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day by intramuscular [IM] injection), starting on day of oocyte pick-up (OPU) and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

group.title: 150 IU recFSH
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of placebo-corifollitropin alfa administered on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily SC recFSH 150 IU injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including the day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP) administration. Participants also received the GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG. Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on the day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

participants_list.participants: Includes one treated participant who was not randomized

baseline.population: Intent-to-Treat group, which consisted of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Number of Cumulus-oocyte-complexes Retrieved, Per Attempt
outcome.description: The primary efficacy parameter was defined as the number of cumulus-oocyte-complexes retrieved from participants in a controlled ovarian stimulation (COS) cycle for in vitro fertilization (IVF) and/or intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI). For participants who did not have cumulus-oocyte-complex retrieval, the number retrieved was set to zero.

measure.title: Number of Cumulus-oocyte-complexes Retrieved, Per Attempt
measure.description: The primary efficacy parameter was defined as the number of cumulus-oocyte-complexes retrieved from participants in a controlled ovarian stimulation (COS) cycle for in vitro fertilization (IVF) and/or intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI). For participants who did not have cumulus-oocyte-complex retrieval, the number retrieved was set to zero.
measure.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Group, which consisted of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Equivalence margins of -3 and +5 were applied for the difference in the mean number of oocytes between the treatment groups. Org 36286 treatment was considered equivalent to the reference treatment (recFSH) if the two-sided 95% confidence interval of the difference was between -3 and +5 oocytes.

outcome.title: Total Dose of recFSH Administered
outcome.description: Total dose of recFSH (IU) administered was defined as the total amount of recFSH needed by participants to reach the criterion for administration of hCG (at least 3 follicles >=17mm).
outcome.time_frame: One COS cycle (up to a maximum total duration of 19 stimulation days)
outcome.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who received hCG.

group.title: 150 IU recFSH
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of placebo-corifollitropin alfa administered on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily SC recFSH 150 IU injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including the day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP) administration. Participants also received the GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG. Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on the day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

measure.title: Serum Lutenizing Hormone (LH) Levels (Restricted to Participants With hCG Injection)
measure.description: Blood samples for assessment of serum LH were taken prior to injection on Stimulation Day 1, Day 3, Day 5, Day 8, Day of hCG, Day of ET, at the visit two weeks after ET.
measure.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who received hCG.

measurement_list.measurement: If more than 1/2 of the values per assessment day were smaller than the lower limit of quantification (LLOQ) (0.6 IU/L), the median was reported as missing.
If more than 1/2 of the values per assessment day were smaller than LLOQ (0.6 IU/L), the median was reported as missing.

outcome.title: Serum Estradiol (E2) Levels (Restricted to Participants With hCG Injection)

outcome.time_frame: Predose up to 2 weeks after ET (up to maximum of 6 weeks)
outcome.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who received hCG.

Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

measurement_list.measurement: If more than 1/2 of the values per assessment day were smaller than LLOQ (1.2 nmol/L), the median was reported as missing.

outcome.time_frame: Predose up to 2 weeks after ET (up to maximum of 6 weeks)
outcome.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who received hCG.

group.title: 100 μg Corifollitropin Alfa
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of corifollitropin alfa 100 μg (Org 36286) on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily placebo-recFSH injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including Day of hCG administration. measure.title: Serum Inhibin-B Levels (Restricted to Participants With hCG Injection)

measure.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who received hCG.

measurement_list.measurement: If more than 1/2 of the values per assessment day were smaller than LLOQ (10 pg/mL), the median was reported as missing

outcome.title: Number and Size Distribution of Follicles During Stimulation and on the Day of hCG Administration
outcome.description: For each participant, the number of follicles ≥11 mm, ≥15 mm, and ≥17 mm, documented by ultrasonography on defined days during the treatment cycle, was calculated.
outcome.time_frame: Predose up to day of hCG administration (up to a maximum total duration of 19 stimulation days, including day of hCG administration)
outcome.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who received hCG.

group.title: 100 μg Corifollitropin Alfa
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of corifollitropin alfa 100 μg (Org 36286) on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily placebo-recFSH injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including Day of hCG administration. Participants also received GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP). Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

group.title: 150 IU recFSH
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of placebo-corifollitropin alfa administered on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily SC recFSH 150 IU injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including the day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP) administration. Participants also received the GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG. Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on the day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

measure.title: Number and Size Distribution of Follicles During Stimulation and on the Day of hCG Administration
measure.description: For each participant, the number of follicles ≥11 mm, ≥15 mm, and ≥17 mm, documented by ultrasonography on defined days during the treatment cycle, was calculated.
measure.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who received hCG.

outcome.title: Number and Quality of Oocytes Assessed Prior to ICSI (Restricted to Participants With ICSI Only)
outcome.description: The number of oocytes used for ICSI was assessed and categorized based on their quality (i.e., metaphase I oocytes, metaphase II oocytes, and germinal vesicles stage oocytes).
outcome.time_frame: Up to 36 hours after administration of hCG
outcome.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who underwent ICSI.

group.title: 100 μg Corifollitropin Alfa
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of corifollitropin alfa 100 μg (Org 36286) on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily placebo-recFSH injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including Day of hCG administration. Participants also received GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP). Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

group.title: 150 IU recFSH
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of placebo-corifollitropin alfa administered on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily SC recFSH 150 IU injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including the day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP) administration. Participants also received the GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG. Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on the day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

measure.title: Number and Quality of Oocytes Assessed Prior to ICSI (Restricted to Participants With ICSI Only)
measure.description: The number of oocytes used for ICSI was assessed and categorized based on their quality (i.e., metaphase I oocytes, metaphase II oocytes, and germinal vesicles stage oocytes).
measure.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who underwent ICSI.

outcome.title: Fertilization Rate
outcome.description: Fertilization rate, defined as 100 times the ratio of the number of fertilized 2 pronuclei (PN) oocytes obtained and the number of oocytes incubated, was tabulated for each treatment group.
outcome.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who received fertilized oocytes.

group.title: 100 μg Corifollitropin Alfa
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of corifollitropin alfa 100 μg (Org 36286) on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily placebo-recFSH injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including Day of hCG administration. Participants also received GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP). Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

group.title: 150 IU recFSH
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of placebo-corifollitropin alfa administered on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily SC recFSH 150 IU injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including the day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP) administration. Participants also received the GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG. Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on the day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

measure.title: Fertilization Rate
measure.description: Fertilization rate, defined as 100 times the ratio of the number of fertilized 2 pronuclei (PN) oocytes obtained and the number of oocytes incubated, was tabulated for each treatment group.
measure.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who received fertilized oocytes.

outcome.title: Number and Quality of Embryos Obtained at Day 3 (Restricted to Participants With IVF and/or ICSI)
outcome.description: Embryo quality was rated Grade 1, 2, 3, or other. Grade 1 represented excellent quality; Grade 2 good quality; Grade 3 fair quality. "Other" grade embryos were those that did not qualify as Grade 1, 2, or 3.
outcome.time_frame: Post fertilization Day 3 (up to a maximum of 2 days after hCG administration)
outcome.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who underwent IVF and/or ICSI.

group.title: 100 μg Corifollitropin Alfa
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of corifollitropin alfa 100 μg (Org 36286) on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily placebo-recFSH injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including Day of hCG administration. Participants also received GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP). Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

group.title: 150 IU recFSH
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of placebo-corifollitropin alfa administered on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily SC recFSH 150 IU injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including the day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP) administration. Participants also received the GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG. Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on the day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

measure.title: Number and Quality of Embryos Obtained at Day 3 (Restricted to Participants With IVF and/or ICSI)
measure.description: Embryo quality was rated Grade 1, 2, 3, or other. Grade 1 represented excellent quality; Grade 2 good quality; Grade 3 fair quality. "Other" grade embryos were those that did not qualify as Grade 1, 2, or 3.
measure.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who underwent IVF and/or ICSI.

outcome.title: Implantation Rate for Participants With ET
outcome.description: The implantation rate was defined as 100 times the maximum number of gestational sacs as assessed by any ultrasound scan (USS) after ET divided by the number of embryos transferred (per participant), maximized to 100%.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 weeks after ET within a treatment cycle (up to a maximum 10 weeks)
outcome.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who underwent ET.

group.title: 100 μg Corifollitropin Alfa
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of corifollitropin alfa 100 μg (Org 36286) on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily placebo-recFSH injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including Day of hCG administration. Participants also received GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP). Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

group.title: 150 IU recFSH
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of placebo-corifollitropin alfa administered on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily SC recFSH 150 IU injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including the day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP) administration. Participants also received the GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG. Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on the day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

measure.title: Implantation Rate for Participants With ET
measure.description: The implantation rate was defined as 100 times the maximum number of gestational sacs as assessed by any ultrasound scan (USS) after ET divided by the number of embryos transferred (per participant), maximized to 100%.
measure.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who underwent ET.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Miscarriages
outcome.description: A miscarriage, also known as a "spontaneous abortion," was defined as the loss of a fetus without induction or instrumentation.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 10 weeks after ET (up to a maximum of 14 weeks)
outcome.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who had a biological pregnancy.

group.title: 100 μg Corifollitropin Alfa
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of corifollitropin alfa 100 μg (Org 36286) on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily placebo-recFSH injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including Day of hCG administration. Participants also received GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP). Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

group.title: 150 IU recFSH
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of placebo-corifollitropin alfa administered on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily SC recFSH 150 IU injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including the day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP) administration. Participants also received the GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG. Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on the day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Miscarriages
measure.description: A miscarriage, also known as a "spontaneous abortion," was defined as the loss of a fetus without induction or instrumentation.
measure.population: Participants from the ITT Group (consisting of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH) who had a biological pregnancy.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Pregnancies
outcome.description: A Biochemical Pregnancy was defined as a pregnancy proven by a biochemical pregnancy test. (Participants not having a positive biochemical pregnancy test result, but with an ultrasound showing at least one gestational sac were counted as having a biochemical pregnancy.) A Clinical Pregnancy was defined as the presence of at least one gestational sac as assessed by an USS scan. A Vital Pregnancy was considered the presence of at least one fetus with heart activity as assessed by USS. An Ongoing Pregnancy was defined as the presence of at least one fetus with heart activity at least 10 weeks after ET as assessed by USS or Doppler, or confirmed by live birth.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 10 weeks after ET (up to a maximum of 14 weeks)
outcome.population: ITT Group, which consisted of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH.

group.title: 100 μg Corifollitropin Alfa
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of corifollitropin alfa 100 μg (Org 36286) on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily placebo-recFSH injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including Day of hCG administration. Participants also received GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP). Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

group.title: 150 IU recFSH
group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of placebo-corifollitropin alfa administered on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily SC recFSH 150 IU injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received open-label recFSH (up to 200 IU/day) from Stimulation Day 8 onwards, up to and including the day of hCG (10,000 or 5,000 IU/USP) administration. Participants also received the GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG. Participants also received progesterone (at least 600 mg/day vaginally or 50 mg/day IM), starting on the day of OPU and continuing for at least 6 weeks or up to menses.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Pregnancies
measure.description: A Biochemical Pregnancy was defined as a pregnancy proven by a biochemical pregnancy test. (Participants not having a positive biochemical pregnancy test result, but with an ultrasound showing at least one gestational sac were counted as having a biochemical pregnancy.) A Clinical Pregnancy was defined as the presence of at least one gestational sac as assessed by an USS scan. A Vital Pregnancy was considered the presence of at least one fetus with heart activity as assessed by USS. An Ongoing Pregnancy was defined as the presence of at least one fetus with heart activity at least 10 weeks after ET as assessed by USS or Doppler, or confirmed by live birth.
measure.population: ITT Group, which consisted of all randomized participants who received corifollitropin alfa or recFSH.

reported_events.time_frame: Up to 10 weeks after ET (up to a maximum of 14 weeks)
reported_events.desc: All Participants Treated Group, which included one treated participant who was not randomized.

group.description: Participants received a single SC injection of corifollitropin alfa 100 μg (Org 36286) on Day 2 or 3 of the menstrual cycle and daily placebo-recFSH injections (7 total) from Stimulation Day 1 up to and including Stimulation Day 7. Participants also received the GnRH antagonist ganirelix (0.25 mg) once daily SC starting on Stimulation Day 5 up to and including the Day of hCG. certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any scientific paper, presentation, or other communication concerning the clinical trial described in this protocol will first be submitted to the sponsor, at least six weeks ahead of estimated publication or presentation, for written consent, which shall not be withheld unreasonably.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
